forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 16 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind 13 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph.

weather_report:
This afternoon in Downtown San Francisco, the sun makes a valiant attempt to pierce through the clouds, inviting a reluctant warmth that barely tiptoes above 64 degrees. There’s a briskness in the air, a reminder of the city’s maritime embrace, as the west-southwest winds whistle at 16 to 22 mph, occasionally gusting higher, tossing leaves across sidewalks and sending hair flying in playful disarray. Shadows stretch and dance along the streets, while the atmosphere holds an expectant clarity—a brief interlude between overcast days, though not without hints of the elusive fog, which leaves its ghostly fingerprints along the horizon, particularly near the Golden Gate.

As dusk approaches, expect a gentle settling into a low around 54 degrees, with a soft quilt of clouds tucking the city in for the night. Step out adorned in layers—a light jacket or a cozy sweater would suffice against the cool winds, which remain present into the evening. Perhaps take a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero, where the twinkling lights of the Bay Bridge reflect upon the water, or find solace in one of the many small cafes, sipping on a warm cup of coffee as the city hums softly around you, a perfect end to an afternoon filled with fleeting warmth and spirited breezes.
